Description: Base sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos; exterior: painted and incised whirligig (clockwise) with dot in centre; three narrow concentric bands around; no assured decoration preserved in frieze above.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Lion Group style in Payne 1931, 289.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 66, no. A50)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 219, no. 25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.128) (Phase 1)
